import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 5GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All"

source.5b693f74:
#only read 1000 row
nRowRead = 1000
#define '../input/michelin-restaurants/one-star-michelin-restaurants.csv' as df1 using pandas
df1 = pd.read_csv('../input/michelin-restaurants/one-star-michelin-restaurants.csv', delimiter = ',', nrows= nRowRead)
df1.dataframeName = "one-star-michelin-restaurants.csv"
#take a look at size
nrow, ncol = df1.shape
print(f'There are {nrow} rows and {ncol} columns')
colname = df1.columns
print(colname)

source.fe31a946:

thailand_1star = df1[df1['region'] == 'Thailand']

source.3c9d054b:
#let see if it works out

Thai_res = folium.Map(width=500,height=500,location=bangkok_location, zoom_start=10)

#add markers to map 
for lat, lng, name, city in zip(Thai['latitude'], Thai['longitude'], Thai['name'],  Thai['city']):
    label = '{}, {}'.format(name,city)
    label = folium.Popup(label, parse_html=True)
    folium.Marker([lat, lng],radius=5,popup=label,parse_html=False).add_to(Thai_res)

Thai_res

source.4b02c067:
#let see if it works out

michelin_1star_thailand = folium.Map(width=500,height=500,location=bangkok_location, zoom_start=10)

#add markers to map 
for lat, lng, name, city in zip(thailand_1star['latitude'], thailand_1star['longitude'], thailand_1star['name'],  thailand_1star['city']):
    label = '{}, {}'.format(name,city)
    label = folium.Popup(label, parse_html=True)
    folium.Marker([lat, lng],radius=5,popup=label,parse_html=False).add_to(michelin_1star_thailand)
    
michelin_1star_thailand

source.f46df9a6:
#let see if it works out

michelin_2star_thailand = folium.Map(width=500,height=500,location=bangkok_location, zoom_start=10)

#add markers to map 
for lat, lng, name, city in zip(thailand_2star['latitude'], thailand_2star['longitude'], thailand_2star['name'],  thailand_2star['city']):
    label = '{}, {}'.format(name,city)
    label = folium.Popup(label, parse_html=True)
    folium.Marker([lat, lng],radius=5,popup=label,parse_html=False).add_to(michelin_2star_thailand)
    
michelin_2star_thailand
